page.title: 19Backford
page.content: Backford School was built for the education of poor people in the 1840's. The first teacher was William Gerard in 1844. The present head teacher is Miss Chowen. There are only two classes in the main school and a mobile classroom for forty three children. It now has a playground and a playing field. St. Oswalds's Church in Backford has a red stone tower, body and chancel and it was rebuilt in 1728. There is a window that was painted for Richard Radclyffe, the Lord of Backford around 1450. Fields in Backford were used for council houses in 1947. Traffic lights were erected on the A41 road in 1969, followed by the post box and 'phone box were also added three years later. In 1981 the M56 was opened. There are now only 4 working farms in Backford.
